Text:
The ancient city of Alexandria—a legendary city, said
to be located far east of Midgar.

It is a natural stronghold, surrounded on three sides
by steep cliffs and to the west by the Abyss Woods,
which is protected by the Mist Dragon’s poison mist.

Once the symbol of an old king's prosperity, it is now
nothing more than a ruin...

However, the ancient city is about to be reborn as
Shadow and the Shadow Garden's new home...
...Through dangerous and ruthless experiments!

We've finished our relocation from the ghost town,
but now is when the Shadow Garden's real battle
begins.

In the meantime, there's much to be done to improve
urban functions, train our members, secure logistics,
and build our war chest.

Gamma is working on the city's operations and on
raising capital.

That said, the land of Alexandria is surprisingly
fertile. We must take advantage of this.
Do you mean farming and livestock?
Yes. Here we can do it away from prying eyes.

I'm certain Gamma can make excellent use of this
land to develop various products to sell.

In that case, another urgent task is to improve the
city's defenses.

The west side of the ancient city is geographically
the least defended although it is protected by the
Abyss Woods and the Mist Dragon's poison mist.
All the more reason not to let our guard down.

How about we add defense capabilities to our training
facility?

Since members will train there regularly, it can
double as a defense during emergencies.

Excellent idea. As the one responsible for training
the members, I've no objections.
In that case—Eta.

We'll need to build a training facility for the
members here in Alexandria that doubles
as a base defense system.
I wanna...build...
...the training...base...defense...
Can I leave it to you then?
...Yeah.
Allow me to assist you in any way I can.
...Yeah.
Done... Lambda?
Yes, I'm here.
...Gonna build something awesome.
Something awesome?
Here's...the blueprint...and concept drawing.
May I?
...Yeah.
Thank you.
In-Incredible!
Are you really going to build this?
Yeah...sure.

If you can make this a reality, it would not only
fully meet Lady Alpha's requirements, but also
exceed expectations and functions!

But...this...may take things a little too far. If we
were to train in such an environment, it would
be, um, positively life-threatening—
Help me build it.
Help me build it.
Sir! Yes sir!
Okay...good. Let the fun times...begin.
Oh dear... I have a bad feeling about this!
